Math Study Notes

Author: Andrew Tomazos andrewtomazos@gmail.com

Date: 2021-03-03

I’m revising some topics in mathematics, and these are my notes.

Topic: Linear Algebra

Text: Introduction to Linear Algebra Fifth Edition by Gilbert Strang.

Problem set 1.1

1.

Descibe geometrically (line, plane, or all of ℝ3) all linear combinations of

  1. $ $ and $ $

Here we see that v2 = 3v1, therefore these two vectors are collinear. Their linear combinations describe a line through the origin and v1 (which also contains v2).

  1. $ $ and $ $

These two vectors are not collinear. There is no constant k such that v2 = kv1. Therefore these two vectors describe a plane that contains the origin, v1 and v2.

  1. $ $ and $ $ and $ $

None of these three vectors can be described as a linear combination of the others, therefore they describe the entire ℝ3 plane.
